title: Nigel Burgess (yachtsman)
text:
Nigel Allan Burgess (1942–1992) was a British <a href="single-handed%20sailing">single-handed</a> <a href="yachtsman">yachtsman</a>, <a href="Master%20Mariner">Master Mariner</a> and businessman. He took part in the <a href="Single-Handed%20Trans-Atlantic%20Race">OSTAR</a> and the <a href="Vend%C3%A9e%20Globe">Vendée Globe</a>. He founded Nigel Burgess Yacht Brokers, a company which has remained one of the leading yachtbrokers in the world, and was responsible for the sale of <a href="Saddam%20Hussein">Saddam Hussein</a>'s yacht in 2008.
Biography.
Born in 1942 in <a href="Cheam">Cheam</a>, Surrey he was educated at <a href="Homefield%20Preparatory%20School">Homefield Preparatory School</a> and <a href="Thames%20Nautical%20Training%20College">Thames Nautical Training College</a>. He served with the <a href="Royal%20Fleet%20Auxiliary">Royal Fleet Auxiliary</a> (RFA) gaining his <a href="Master%20mariner">master's ticket</a>. His first major single handed yacht race was the Observer <a href="Single-Handed%20Trans-Atlantic%20Race">Single-Handed Trans-Atlantic Race</a> in 1968 in which he sailed his yacht "Dogwatch".
On leaving the RFA he established Nigel Burgess Yacht Brokers and moved his home to Monaco.
He subsequently entered the 1988 Carlsberg <a href="Single-Handed%20Trans-Atlantic%20Race">Single-Handed Trans-Atlantic Race</a> in "Dogwatch A" coming first in his class.
In 1992 he entered that year's <a href="Vend%C3%A9e%20Globe">Vendée Globe</a> and was lost at sea three days into the race.
